intro: Psilothonna capillacea, commonly known as the slender hairroot plant, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
